newsitem.title: USA: U.S West Coast crude off with WTI, ANS offers fall.
newsitem.headline: U.S West Coast crude off with WTI, ANS offers fall.

text.p: U.S. West Coast crude prices pared early gains to close a touch higher than Monday, while traders claimed that Alaskan crude offers softened.
Industry sources said a major producer of Alaska North Slope (ANS) crude lowered its November sale price for ANS by 10 cents, making it $2.10 off West Texas Intermediate.
November WTI led ANS down by falling five cents from midday to $24.30/24.40 a barrel after a day of fluctuations.
Meanwhile, Ultramar denied early rumors of problems at its fluid catalytic cracker in Wilmington, Calif.
Major bids remained $2.50 less WTT, and the last done deal was at $2.30 off WTI.
Line 63 remained unchanged at $3.20 to $3.00 under spot WTI for November delivery.
Kern River, from California's San Joaquin Valley, was unchanged at $16.15/16.35 a barrel.
And prices for Long Beach-based Wilmington crude held at $17.60/17.70.
